channel.title: UEFA.com European football podcast 2009
channel.itunes:subtitle: Savour the action and reaction to each UEFA Champions League matchweek.
channel.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
channel.itunes:summary: Every Friday of every matchweek UEFA.com brings you the best UEFA Champions League podcast online. Featuring match highlights, expert analysis and player interviews the podcast gives an in-depth review of every week. And not standing still, each podcast will also look ahead to the next action in the competition.
channel.description: Every Friday of every matchweek UEFA.com brings you the best UEFA Champions League podcast online. Featuring match highlights, expert analysis and player interviews the podcast gives an in-depth review of every week. And not standing still, each podcast will also look ahead to the next action in the competition.

item.title: Barça the kings of Europe (29.05.09)
item.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
item.description: Tune in as we hear from the likes of Josep Guardiola, Gerard Piqué, Sir Alex Ferguson and Cristiano Ronaldo after Manchester United FC relinquished their European crown to FC Barcelona in Rome.
item.itunes:subtitle: Tune in as we hear from the likes of Josep Guardiola, Gerard Piqué, Sir Alex Ferguson and Cristiano Ronaldo after Manchester United FC relinquished their European crown to FC Barcelona in Rome.
item.itunes:summary: Tune in as we hear from the likes of Josep Guardiola, Gerard Piqué, Sir Alex Ferguson and Cristiano Ronaldo after Manchester United FC relinquished their European crown to FC Barcelona in Rome.

item.title: Destination Rome for Barça & United (08.05.09)
item.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
item.description: Manchester United FC and FC Barcelona will contest the final of the UEFA Champions League after sealing aggregate victories over Arsenal FC and Chelsea FC on Matchday 12. Tune in as we look back on the best of the action with Sir Alex Ferguson, Kolo Touré, Guus Hiddink, Josep Guardiola and Gerard Piqué.
item.itunes:subtitle: Manchester United FC and FC Barcelona will contest the final of the UEFA Champions League after sealing aggregate victories over Arsenal FC and Chelsea FC on Matchday 12. Tune in as we look back on the best of the action with Sir Alex Ferguson, Kolo Touré, Guus Hiddink, Josep Guardiola and Gerard Piqué.
item.itunes:summary: Manchester United FC and FC Barcelona will contest the final of the UEFA Champions League after sealing aggregate victories over Arsenal FC and Chelsea FC on Matchday 12. Tune in as we look back on the best of the action with Sir Alex Ferguson, Kolo Touré, Guus Hiddink, Josep Guardiola and Gerard Piqué.

item.title: United seize slender advantage (01.05.09)
item.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
item.description: Manchester United FC were the only side to score in the UEFA Champions League semi-final first legs, but all four teams are still very much on course for a trip to Rome on May 27. Tune in as we look back on the best of the Matchday 11 action and catch up Jon O'Shea, Manuel Almunia, Xavi Hernández and Josep Guardiola.
item.itunes:subtitle: Manchester United FC were the only side to score in the UEFA Champions League semi-final first legs, but all four teams are still very much on course for a trip to Rome on May 27. Tune in as we look back on the best of the Matchday 11 action and catch up Jon O'Shea, Manuel Almunia, Xavi Hernández and Josep Guardiola.
item.itunes:summary: Manchester United FC were the only side to score in the UEFA Champions League semi-final first legs, but all four teams are still very much on course for a trip to Rome on May 27. Tune in as we look back on the best of the Matchday 11 action and catch up Jon O'Shea, Manuel Almunia, Xavi Hernández and Josep Guardiola.

item.title: Last four lineup complete (17.04.09)
item.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
item.description: Barcelona joined three English clubs in the semi-finals of the UEFA Champions League after another incredible week of action in Europe's premier club competition. Tune in as we hear from Wayne Rooney, Rafael Benítez, Dirk Kuyt, Guus Hiddink, Frank Lampard, Theo Walcott, Mariano & Robert Pires.
item.itunes:subtitle: Barcelona joined three English clubs in the semi-finals of the UEFA Champions League after another incredible week of action in Europe's premier club competition. Tune in as we hear from Wayne Rooney, Rafael Benítez, Dirk Kuyt, Guus Hiddink, Frank Lampard, Theo Walcott, Mariano & Robert Pires.
item.itunes:summary: Barcelona joined three English clubs in the semi-finals of the UEFA Champions League after another incredible week of action in Europe's premier club competition. Tune in as we hear from Wayne Rooney, Rafael Benítez, Dirk Kuyt, Guus Hiddink, Frank Lampard, Theo Walcott, Mariano & Robert Pires.

item.title: Race to Rome continues (10.04.09)
item.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
item.description: The battle for places in Rome continued at full pace on Matchday 9 as the eight remaining teams in the UEFA Champions League produced a sensational bout of quarter-final first-leg action. Tune in as we hear from Rafael Benítez, Didier Drogba, Lionel Messi, Marcos Senna, Emmanuel Adebayor, Giuseppe Rossi, Mariano, Jesualdo Ferreira, Michael Carrick, Mark van Bommel.
item.itunes:subtitle: The battle for places in Rome continued at full pace on Matchday 9 as the eight remaining teams in the UEFA Champions League produced a sensational bout of quarter-final first-leg action. Tune in as we hear from Rafael Benítez, Didier Drogba, Lionel Messi, Marcos Senna, Emmanuel Adebayor, Giuseppe Rossi, Mariano, Jesualdo Ferreira, Michael Carrick, Mark van Bommel.

item.title: Holders lead the way (13.03.09)
item.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
item.description: The line-up for the last eight of the UEFA Champions League is now complete after a sensational bout of action on Matchday 8, so tune in as we hear from Cristiano Ronaldo, Fernando Torres, Giuseppe Rossi, Thierry Henry, Frank Lampard, Guus Hiddink, Lucho, Henk Ten Cate and Rafael Benítez.
item.itunes:subtitle: The line-up for the last eight of the UEFA Champions League is now complete after a sensational bout of action on Matchday 8, so tune in as we hear from Cristiano Ronaldo, Fernando Torres, Giuseppe Rossi, Thierry Henry, Frank Lampard, Guus Hiddink, Lucho, Henk Ten Cate and Rafael Benítez.
item.itunes:summary: The line-up for the last eight of the UEFA Champions League is now complete after a sensational bout of action on Matchday 8, so tune in as we hear from Cristiano Ronaldo, Fernando Torres, Giuseppe Rossi, Thierry Henry, Frank Lampard, Guus Hiddink, Lucho, Henk Ten Cate and Rafael Benítez.

item.title: Europe's best return in style (27.02.2009)
item.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
item.description: The UEFA Champions League returned in majestic style on Matchday 7, so tune in as we hear from José Mourinho, Cristiano Ronaldo, Yossi Benayoun, Diego Forlán, Jon Arne Riise, Franck Ribéry, Gilberto Silva, Josep Guardiola and Jesualdo Ferreira.
item.itunes:subtitle: The UEFA Champions League returned in majestic style on Matchday 7, so tune in as we hear from José Mourinho, Cristiano Ronaldo, Yossi Benayoun, Diego Forlán, Jon Arne Riise, Franck Ribéry, Gilberto Silva, Josep Guardiola and Jesualdo Ferreira.

item.title: Thrilling climax to group stage (11.12.08)
item.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
item.description: Matchday 6 of the UEFA Champions League saw numerous qualifications issues settled, so tune in as we hear from Petr Čech, Francesco Totti, Henk Ten Cate, Temuri Ketsbaia, José Mourinho, Rafael Benítez and Nicklas Bendtner. Plus there's in-depth analysis of the week's biggest and best games.
item.itunes:subtitle: Matchday 6 of the UEFA Champions League saw numerous qualifications issues settled, so tune in as we hear from Petr Čech, Francesco Totti, Henk Ten Cate, Temuri Ketsbaia, José Mourinho, Rafael Benítez and Nicklas Bendtner. Plus there's in-depth analysis of the week's biggest and best games.

Plus there's in-depth analysis of the week's biggest and best games.

item.title: Europe's élite put on grand show
item.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
item.description: Matchday 5 of the UEFA Champions League turned out to be decisive, so tune in as we hear from Sir Alex Ferguson, José Mourinho, Laurent Blanc, Fabio Grosso, Luca Toni, Cesc Fàbregas and Javier Saviola. Plus there's in-depth analysis of the week's biggest and best games.

item.title: Shooting from the lip
item.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
item.description: Hardly shy as a player, Ford Champion Stefan Effenberg is not without an opinion on Bayern's campaign.
item.itunes:subtitle: Hardly shy as a player, Ford Champion Stefan Effenberg is not without an opinion on Bayern's campaign.

item.title: Time is right for Inter (07.11.2008)
item.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
item.description: Internazionale midfielder Patrick Vieira discusses José Mourinho, Zlatan Ibrahimovi<FONT face="Century Gothic">ć and his hopes of European glory this season.</FONT>

item.title: Duo through as Roma bounce back (07.11.08)
item.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
item.description: Get the thoughts of John Terry, José Mourinho, Arsène Wenger, Franck Ribéry, Rafael Benítez and Derlei as we reflect on another dramatic matchday of UEFA Champions League action.

item.title: Goals, goals, goals (24.10.08)
item.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
item.description: We hear from Wayne Rooney, Gordon Strachan, Joseba Llorente, Claudio Ranieri, Luca Toni, John Terry, Temuri Ketsbaia and Arsène Wenger, plus bring you opinion and analysis after a spectacular Matchday 3 of the UEFA Champions League.
item.itunes:subtitle: We hear from Wayne Rooney, Gordon Strachan, Joseba Llorente, Claudio Ranieri, Luca Toni, John Terry, Temuri Ketsbaia and Arsène Wenger, plus bring you opinion and analysis after a spectacular Matchday 3 of the UEFA Champions League.

item.title: Big guns forge ahead (03.10.08)
item.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
item.description: The latest edition of this season's uefa.com European Football Podcast offers analysis and exclusive post-match reaction from a sensational Matchday 2 of the UEFA Champions League as Manchester United and Barcelona secured vital wins.
item.itunes:subtitle: The latest edition of this season's uefa.com European Football Podcast offers analysis and exclusive post-match reaction from a sensational Matchday 2 of the UEFA Champions League as Manchester United and Barcelona secured vital wins.

item.title: Underdogs take centre stage (19.09.08)
item.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
item.description: The first edition of this season's uefa.com European Football Podcast brings you all the news, in-depth analysis and post-match reaction from Matchday 1 of the UEFA Champions League as debutants CFR 1907 Cluj and Anorthosis Famagusta FC were among those grabbing the headlines.

item.title: Frisk reflects on European season
item.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
item.description: Legendary referee Anders Frisk looks back on an action-packed season of UEFA Champions League football and assesses the standard of football and officiating in Europe's premier club competition.
item.itunes:subtitle: Legendary referee Anders Frisk looks back on an action-packed season of UEFA Champions League football and assesses the standard of football and officiating in Europe's premier club competition.

item.title: Stefan Effenberg talks about the UEFA Champions League
item.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
item.description: In the latest of our Ford vodcasts, The German midfield legend talks of his love for Europe's premier club competition and was not surprised to see two English clubs in the final.
item.itunes:subtitle: In the latest of our Ford vodcasts, The German midfield legend talks of his love for Europe's premier club competition and was not surprised to see two English clubs in the final.

item.title: MD13 Final Podcast (21.05.08)
item.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
item.description: In this final matchnight podcast of the season, uefa.com looks back on the UEFA Champions League final in Moscow and brings you all the action and exclusive reaction from Edwin van der Sar, Cristiano Ronaldo and Frank Lampard.
item.itunes:subtitle: MD13 Final Podcast (21.05.08)

item.title: MD12 wednesday match highlights Podcast (30.04.08)
item.itunes:author: uefa.com Europe's Football Website
item.description: On this edition, we look back at a spellbinding night of action as Chelsea overcame Liverpool to book their place in the UEFA Champions League final in Moscow; including highlights, analysis and reaction.
item.itunes:subtitle: It is third time lucky as Chelsea FC finally defeat Liverpool FC to earn a date with Manchester United FC in the UEFA Champions League final.
item.itunes:summary: On this edition, we look back at a spellbinding night of action as Chelsea overcame Liverpool to book their place in the UEFA Champions League final in Moscow; including highlights, analysis and reaction.
